title: How Many Calories Are in a Half Cup of Rice?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a half cup of rice, including full macro breakdown, per-100g basis, equivalents, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Half Cup of Rice?
assumptions: Cooked white long-grain rice, unenriched; 1 cup ≈158 g cooked volume, so half cup ≈79 g. No added salt, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type (white, brown, jasmine), brand, cooking method, and exact volume/weight. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A half cup of cooked white rice provides about 103 kcal and 22 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil during cooking per 100 g
Use jasmine rice (slightly more aromatic, similar nutrition)

faqs.q: How many calories are in a half cup of cooked white rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 103 kcal for a half cup (79 g) of cooked white rice.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a half cup of rice?
faqs.a: About 22.3 g of carbohydrates, mostly starch, with 0.3 g fiber.

faqs.q: How much does a half cup of rice weigh?
faqs.a: Roughly 79 g for cooked white rice; volume can vary by packing and type.

faqs.q: Are there calories in uncooked rice per half cup?
faqs.a: A half cup dry rice (≈92 g) has about 330 kcal, but it expands when cooked.

faqs.q: Does brown rice have fewer calories than white?
faqs.a: Slightly—about 123 kcal per 100 g cooked vs. 130 kcal for white, plus more fiber.
